campaignEntries.rawText:
## Melee
| D20 Roll | Mishap |
|----------|---------|
| 1 | You stumble and momentarily lose sight of your enemy. Any attacks against you have advantage until your next turn. |
| 2 | You accidentally strike a nearby object, causing your weapon to bounce back towards you. Make a DC10 Dexterity save or take weapon's damage. |
| 3 | Your weapon slips from your grasp. Roll a D6. On a 1-3, it lands 10 feet away from you in a random direction. On a 4-6, it lands at your opponent's feet. |
| 4 | You swing so wide, you pivot a full circle on the spot, leaving you disoriented. You are stunned until your next turn. |
| 5 | You throw your balance off, causing you to fall prone. |
| 6 | Such a wild swing! The impact shatters your weapon, rendering it unusable. |
| 7 | You expose a vulnerability in your attack. The next attack against you has advantage. |
| 8 | Your fury gets the best of you. You use your bonus action to make another attack, but this one is made at disadvantage. |
| 9 | A misstep makes you slip. Your movement is reduced by half until your next turn. |
| 10 | The world spins as you lose your balance. You are considered to be under the effects of the Confusion spell until your next turn. |
| 11 | Your attack is such a whiff, it throws you off-guard. You cannot make AoOs until your next turn. |
| 12 | You overexert yourself, take 1 level of exhaustion. |
| 13 | You strike the surface unintentionally, causing a cloud of dust to temporarily blind you. You are blinded until your next turn. |
| 14 | Your weapon gets momentarily stuck in the surface. Your next round action must be used to free it. |
| 15 | You trip and scatter your equipped inventory around you. You must spend your next turn retrieving your items. |
| 16 | Misjudging your own strength, you rip a muscle. You have disadvantage on Strength checks and saves until you finish a short rest. |
| 17 | Your swing comes so close to your enemy that you clip them. They can use their reaction to make a melee attack against you. |
| 18 | You miscalculate your swing massively, causing you to lose your grip. Your weapon flies 10 feet in a random direction. |
| 19 | Your unwieldy swing elicits a painful cramp. You have disadvantage on your next attack roll. |
| 20 | You stumble badly on some debris. You must make a DC10 Dexterity save or fall prone in a prone square adjacent to the obstacle. |

## Ranged
| d20 Roll | Ranged Attack Mishap |
| -------- | -------------------- |
| 1        | The string or trigger mechanism on your weapon snaps, rendering it useless until repaired. | 
| 2        | The force of the shot twists in your hand, causing you to drop your weapon at your feet. |
| 3        | Your weapon discharges early, the sound alerts enemies of your location and gives them advantage on their next attack. |
| 4        | The recoil of the weapon causes you to lose your footing and you fall prone. |
| 5        | The shot goes wild and hits an unintended target, maybe an ally or a harmless piece of environment. |
| 6        | The ammunition you were using was defective and shatters inside your weapon, damaging it. |
| 7        | The shot ricochets back towards you, make a Dexterity saving throw to avoid getting hit. |
| 8        | Whether by wind or miscalculation, your shot veers off so badly it completely misses the combat arena. |
| 9        | The force of the shot strains your arm, causing numbness. You have disadvantage on your next attack. |
| 10       | Misjudged power sends the shot into the ground at your feet, kicking up debris and blinding you until the end of your next turn. |
| 11       | Your shot distracts an ally, causing them to lose concentration on any ongoing spells. |
| 12       | Your wild shot hits an object or part of the environment, causing it to collapse or change the field in some way. |
| 13       | You accidentally ignite any flammable material in your vicinity. |
| 14       | You miscalculate your range, leaving you vulnerable to an opponent's attack. |
| 15       | You strain too hard during the shot and pull a muscle, taking 1d4 damage. |
| 16       | Opponents take advantage of the delay in your attack, they move 10 ft without provoking opportunity attacks. |
| 17       | Your attack hits a reflective surface and bounces back at you. An attack roll is made against you. |
| 18       | The attack careens wildly, hitting random objects and creating a hazardous environment. |
| 19       | Your weapon jams or malfunctions in some way, requiring a full round to unjam or repair. |
| 20       | The force of your launch breaks your weapon into pieces. It is destroyed, and can only be replaced, not repaired. |

## Arcane
| D20 Roll | Arcane Attack Mishap |
| -------- | --------------------- |
| 1 | You rebound your spell onto yourself, taking the intended damage.
| 2 | You lose control of the magic, causing a random magical effect (use the Wild Magic Surge table). 
| 3 | Your arcane energies backfire, giving you a level of fatigue. 
| 4 | The overwhelming force of your failure causes you to be prone. 
| 5 | The spell fizzles and you lose an additional spell slot of the same level. 
| 6 | A surge of magic pushes your target 10 feet away from you without causing harm.
| 7 | The spell is delayed. It will misfire in the same spot in the next round.
| 8 | Your spell affects a random target within range.
| 9 | You are momentarily blinded by your own spell backlash until the end of your next turn. 
| 10 | The spell mishap causes you to be deafened for 1 minute.
| 11 | Your arcane failure leaves you vulnerable, reducing your AC by 2 until your next turn.
| 12 | Instead of the intended spell, a harmless puff of smoke billows out from your fingertips.
| 13 | Your mishap creates a loud booming noise audible within 100 feet.
| 14 | The magic arcs to a non-magical item in your possession, rendering it useless.
| 15 | You cast the spell, but at its minimum power level.
| 16 | The backfire dazzles you: disadvantage on all ability checks for the next round.
| 17 | Your arcane mishap attracts the attention of a nearby creature, hostile or not.
| 18 | The magic backlash leaves you silenced for 1 minute, unable to cast spells with a verbal component.
| 19 | The arcane energies cause a 10-foot radius of difficult terrain centered on you.
| 20 | The spell energy ricochets off, causing the light level within 30 feet of you to decrease by one step for 1 hour.

## Melee
| d20 Roll | Critical Success Boon |
|----------|----------------------|
| 1. | Your attack opens up a weak spot, granting advantage to the next ally who attacks this enemy. |
| 2. | Your strike destabilizes your opponent, reducing their speed to half for one round. |
| 3. | Your hit is so powerful it knocks the weapon out of your enemy's hand. |
| 4. | Your precision strike disorientates the enemy, causing them to skip their next bonus action. |
| 5. | Your attack causes your enemy to stagger backwards, provoking an opportunity attack from a nearby ally. |
| 6. | Your forceful blow knocks the enemy prone. |
| 7. | You perform a perfect cut, causing your enemy to bleed and take 1d4 damage at the start of its next turn. |
| 8. | Your strike causes the enemy to be frightened until the end of your next turn. |
| 9. | Your devastating attack shocks the enemy, causing them to miss their next reaction. |
| 10. | Your attack causes extra damage equal to your level. |
| 11. | Your weapon hit shatters the enemy's defense, reducing their AC by 1 until their next turn. |
| 12. | Your powerful strike forces the enemy to lose their concentration. |
| 13. | Your blow is precise, hitting the enemy's vitals and dealing ongoing 1d6 damage for the next three turns. |
| 14. | You drive your enemy back, pushing them 10ft away from you. |
| 15. | Your hit damages the enemy's gear, causing a disadvantage on their next attack roll. |
| 16. | Your attack intimidates nearby enemies, giving them disadvantage on their next attack rolls. |
| 17. | The power behind your strike temporarily blinds the enemy until the start of the enemy's next turn. |
| 18. | With a swift move, you disarm the enemy. |
| 19. | Your strike breaks the enemy's guard, leaving them stunned until the end of their next turn. |
| 20. | Your devastating hit energizes you, restoring 1d8 hit points. |

## Ranged
| Roll (D20) | Boon Due to Critical Ranged Attack Success |
| --- | --- |
| 1 | The arrow/bolt finds a weakness in the enemy's armor, reducing their AC by 2 for the rest of the combat. |
| 2 | Your missile ricochets, striking an additional enemy within 10 feet of the original target for half damage. |
| 3 | The force of your hit disarms your opponent, their weapon flies 10 feet away in a random direction. |
| 4 | You hit a vital organ causing bleed damage. The enemy takes an additional 1d6 damage at the start of their turn until it gets healed. |
| 5 | The impact of your projectile knocks the enemy prone. |
| 6 | Your aim is terrifyingly precise, causing the enemy to become frightened until the end of your next turn. |
| 7 | The projectile pierces through the target hitting another enemy in line with the first one. Roll another attack for the second target, this hit can't crit. |
| 8 | Your shot distracts the enemy at the perfect moment, providing advantage to the next ally who attacks them. |
| 9 | You're so quick to nock and loose another arrow that you can make an additional attack this round. |
| 10 | The arrow/bolt hits the target so hard that it is pushed back 10 feet away from the impact. |
| 11 | You stun your enemy with the impact. They lose their next reaction. |
| 12 | The enemy is so shocked by your attack that they suffer disadvantage on their next attack roll. |
| 13 | Your target drops any item they hold as your shot numbs their hand. |
| 14 | Your shot lands exactly as you planned. You regain your highest level expended spell slot or a superiority die. |
| 15 | Your projectile impacts with such force that the target is unable to move until they pass a strength saving throw (DC 15) on their turn. |
| 16 | Your attack has such a demoralizing effect on enemies that they suffer disadvantage on saving throws until end of your next turn. |
| 17 | Your shot strikes a pressure point causing intense pain. The target suffers disadvantage on skill checks until it receives healing. |
| 18 | Your shot puts you in a commanding position, giving you an additional reaction until the start of your next turn. |
| 19 | The sight of your talent inspires your allies. The next attack roll made by each ally has advantage. |
| 20 | Your attack is a display of sheer perfection. Your target has disadvantage on attack rolls against you until end of your next turn. |

## Arcane
| d20 | Boon from a Critical Arcane Success |
| --- | ---------------------------------- |
| 1   | Your spell is so perfectly cast that it doesn't consume a spell slot. |
| 2   | The target of your spell is dazed, suffering disadvantage on their next turn. |
| 3   | Your spell's duration, if it has one, is doubled. |
| 4   | The area of effect of your spell increases by 50%. |
| 5   | The damage of your spell is maximized, not just doubled. |
| 6   | The target of your spell drops everything it is holding. |
| 7   | Any allies near the spell's target gain temporary HP equal to the spell's level. |
| 8   | The target of your spell is knocked prone. |
| 9   | Your spell is silent and does not require verbal components. |
| 10  | Your spell does not require material components, if it did before. |
| 11  | The intensity of your spell frightens enemies, forcing a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened. |
| 12  | An echoed force of the spell lingers on the target, causing it to reapply half the initial damage at the end of its next turn. |
| 13  | You instantly comprehend and memorize the true name of the target, useful in future spellcasting. |
| 14  | You can immediately teleport up to 30 ft away after casting the spell, without consuming a spell slot. |
| 15  | The spell's effect also replicates a cantrip of your choice. |
| 16  | Residual energy shields you, granting advantage on your next saving throw. |
| 17  | A shimmering phantom version of your incantation circles you, granting you +2 to AC until your next turn. |
| 18  | Buffets of force from your spell push enemies within 10 ft, forcing a Strength saving throw or be pushed back 10 ft. |
| 19  | Your spell illuminates the battlefield, nullifying the effects of low light or darkness in a 20 ft radius. |
| 20  | Echoes of your power surge through you, your next spell of 1st level or higher cast within the next minute is increased by one spell level. |

## Aarakocra
| Dice Value | Name        | Description                                                                              |
|------------|-------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 1          | Windcaller  | An insightful Aarakocra healer known for her calming songs and wisdom                    |
| 2          | Cloudskipper| An adventurous Aarakocra scout who’s spent his life exploring the world from above        |
| 3          | Raindancer  | A charismatic Aarakocra bard skilled in the dance of his tribe                           |
| 4          | Stormbeak   | A gruff Aarakocra fighter whose sharp beak and talons are matched by his strategic mind  |
| 5          | Sunplume    | An Aarakocra monk studying the Fluid Motion school of martial arts                       |
| 6          | Firesinger  | An imaginative Aarakocra sorcerer with an affinity for fire magic                        |
| 7          | Stoneclaw   | A dedicated Aarakocra artisan renowned for his beautifully detailed carvings             |
| 8          | Icefeather  | A reclusive Aarakocra wizard studying the arcane secrets of ice magic                    |
| 9          | Thunderwing | A respected Aarakocra chieftain known for his thunderous battle cries                    |
| 10         | Moonshadow  | An elusive Aarakocra rogue who moves as silently as a shadow across the moonlit sky       |
| 11         | Dimlight    | A wise Aarakocra sage with knowledge that reaches far beyond her years                   |
| 12         | Swiftwind   | A young, restless Aarakocra ranger eager to prove himself on the hunt                    |
| 13         | Sunspark    | A cheerful Aarakocra cleric who worships a sun deity                                     |
| 14         | Darkfeather | Once an ordinary Aarakocra, he now practices warlock magic after a deal with a dark entity|
| 15         | Snowpeaks   | A hardy Aarakocra from a cold mountain range, accustomed to harsh weather conditions     |
| 16         | Galeswooper | A vigilant Aarakocra sentinel who guards the nest from threats                           |
| 17         | Starwatcher | An Aarakocra astronomer whose eyes are usually turned towards the stars                   |
| 18         | Brighteye   | A particularly perceptive Aarakocra scout with excellent eyesight                         |
| 19         | Stormcaster | An Aarakocra druid who calls upon the power of the storm with her magic                   |
| 20         | Skydancer   | A jovial, light-hearted Aarakocra bard known for his breathtaking aerial dances           |

## Aasimar
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|------------|-------|-------------|
| 1 | Iridius | An Aasimar cleric with silvery hair and radiant eyes, dedicated to the god of light. |
| 2 | Seraphina | A tall and stern Aasimar paladin, possessed by the spirit of an otherworldly warrior. |
| 3 | Uriel | A wise and noble Aasimar bard who brings tales from far-off lands. |
| 4 | Haloa | A mild-mannered Aasimar druid with a deep connection to celestial wilds. |
| 5 | Celestia | A charismatic Aasimar sorcerer who channels raw celestial power. |
| 6 | Galileo | A cryptic Aasimar warlock who negotiates with celestial entities. |
| 7 | Angelos | A brave Aasimar ranger who guides travelers through dangerous lands. |
| 8 | Elara | A complex Aasimar rogue operating under the guidance of a divine being. |
| 9 | Orion | A calm and measured Aasimar monk, disciplined in celestial ways. |
| 10 | Valeria | A skilled Aasimar fighter whose weapon glows with divine light. |
| 11 | Lysithea | An Aasimar wizard who has studied celestial spells from ancient texts. |
| 12 | Apollo | A charismatic Aasimar bard, his songs tell of divine interventions. |
| 13 | Selene | A dutiful Aasimar cleric who has dedicated her life to healing the hurting. |
| 14 | Eos | A lively Aasimar ranger known to guide lost souls through perilous terrain. |
| 15 | Nyx | A mysterious Aasimar rogue, who uses divine blessings to remain unseen. |
| 16 | Helios | A diligent Aasimar paladin, protected by a divine shield of light. |
| 17 | Astraea | A compassionate Aasimar druid, she uses celestial energy to nurturer nature. |
| 18 | Orion | A noble Aasimar monk, his movements echo the constellations above. |
| 19 | Caelum | An Aasimar wizard, his spells bring celestial might into corporeal form. |
| 20 | Solaria | A headstrong Aasimar sorcerer, her magic is a blazing testament to her celestial heritage. |

## Bugbear
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|---|---|---|
| 1 | Kralk Throatrend | Skilled bugbear warrior hardened by many battles, has a large scar across his throat |
| 2 | Jagar Cragjaw | Wears a necklace of orc teeth, known for his bellowing war cry |
| 3 | Urgol Bloodmaul | Wields a large, bloodstained maul in battle. Tends to solve all problems with violence |
| 4 | Gnarh Wildmane | A competent herbalist, disguises himself in nature despite his huge frame |
| 5 | Throm Axe-Ear | Missing a chunk of ear, cut off in a battle with dwarves. Wields a large greataxe |
| 6 | Grurk Lorekeeper  | Elder bugbear, highly respected, keeper of tribe's history and rituals |
| 7 | Vorkal Beasttamer | Has a trained worg as a pet and hunting partner |
| 8 | Kruk Strongback | Burden bearer of the tribe, carries heavy loot and supplies |
| 9 | Arkosh Longshadow | Elusive bugbear rogue, adept at moving unseen and unheard |
| 10 | Tsork Windwhisper | A scout known for his keen senses, able to detect intruders from a great distance |
| 11 | Gart Bonecrusher | A feared bugbear chieftain known for his cruelty |
| 12 | Kraka Earthshaker | A charismatic bugbear leader, loved by his tribe |
| 13 | Urg Rockhurler | An unerring aim with a boulder has earned him his place in the tribe |
| 14 | Zork Stalker | Expert hunter, often ventures beyond the territory alone |
| 15 | Grumish Flameeye | Lost an eye to a wizard's fire spell, now hates all magic- users |
| 16 | Borsh Skullsmasher | Always the first into battle, wears the skulls of his slain enemies |
| 17 | Nargal Hexweaver | Strange and feared, believed to have the power to curse his enemies |
| 18 | Drukar Thundercall | Powerful bugbear shaman, can 'call' to the spirits of weather |
| 19 | Tsarg Ragetongue | Known for his blistering tirades, he can demoralize enemies before fighting |
| 20 | Mork Daggerclaw | A feared assassin, wears gauntlets tipped with sharp blades as his signature weapon |

## Changeling
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|---|---|---|
|1.|Me'ira| A middle-aged changeling with hollow, empty eyes. Known for their cold efficiency in getting tasks done.|
|2.|Finris| A young unassuming changeling. Their appearances are mostly simple and non-descript, helping them blend in crowds.|
|3.|Eldin| An old, seasoned changeling with a hard, unchanging face that shows the scars of many years of espionage.|
|4.|Ailani| An introverted changeling, often found alone. Tends to maintain a form of an elderly, bespectacled scholar with thinning hair.|
|5.|Jaellyn| A changeling with an irregular twitch in their form, suggesting a past trauma. Usually mimics a reviled outcast.|
|6.|Yorden| A young, enthusiastic changeling. Prefers forms of lively, vibrant characters with lots of jewelry. |
|7.|Tharia| A thoughtful, observant changeling, who mostly dons the form of a rotund, friendly innkeeper, but switches faces with remarkable fluidity when needed.|
|8.|Ilienne| A middle-aged changeling with an artsy vibe. They are mostly seen shape-shifted into a wandering bard.|
|9.|Belisar| A changeling mercenary, seen in many forms, but mostly as a grizzled veteran soldier bearing the marks of many battles.|
|10.|Gallyan| A changeling with a preference for forms of authority figures - guards, commanders, and nobility. |
|11.|Olura| A young female changeling, has a fondness for assuming the forms of children to pass unnoticed.|
|12.|Maridon| An older changeling, often seen posing as a skilled craftsman or a shopkeeper.|
|13.|Danomir| A changeling that prefers to take on menacing forms to intimidate others. Often assumed form of a battle-hardened orc.|
|14.|Estelle| A studious changeling, known to turn into scholarly figures. They take their jobs very seriously.|
|15.|Ursylon| A stern, quiet changeling. They are less likely to change forms, preferring the form of a stern, neutral commoner.|
|16.|Harley| Young and unpredictable, Harley prefers to take on the form of wild, feral creatures.|
|17.|Vanra| Vanra prefers delicate and beautiful forms, often changing into dancers or performers.|
|18.|Casimir| An old changeling who is often seen in the form of a wise old man or a decrepit beggar.|
|19.|Talyssa| Reserved and calculated, Talyssa usually appears as a dignified noblewoman.|
|20.|Zephyr| A crafty changeling known for appearing as different members of the same family or group.|

## Dragon
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|---|---|---|
| 1 | Airthax | An ancient and proud gold dragon, Airthax carries himself with the dignity and gravity befitting his age. |
| 2 | Brenzalth | Brenzalth, a ruby dragon, is known for her meticulous record keeping and knowledge of historical events. |
| 3 | Crystalfire | A young and curious sapphire dragon, Crystalfire can often be found exploring ruins and hoarding relics. |
| 4 | Drakendros | Known for his tactical prowess, Drakendros, a black dragon, is a respected figure in dragon society. |
| 5 | Ebonclaw | A blue dragon, Ebonclaw has a fierce reputation and is known to be a ruthless opponent in battle. |
| 6 | Firewing | Firewing, a brass dragon, has a burning passion for knowledge and has devoted many centuries to its pursuit. |
| 7 | Gormael | This gargantuan silver dragon, Gormael, is renowned for his wisdom and clarity of thought. |
| 8 | Haldryn | Haldryn, a bronze dragon, is a shrewd negotiator and uses this skill to maintain peace among local dragon factions. |
| 9 | Ironflame | A powerful iron dragon, Ironflame is a respected leader known for his just and fair ruling. |
| 10 | Jaxyrith | Famous for her intimidating presence, Jaxyrith, a cobalt dragon, instills both fear and respect in all who encounter her. |
| 11 | Krystalnath | An emerald dragon, Krystalnath is valued for his confidential advice and elusive ability to predict future events. |
| 12 | Pyrophor | Pyrophor, a blazing red dragon, is an awe-inspiring presence who commands respect with his vast knowledge of arcane lore. |
| 13 | Qintarra | Agile and cunning, Qintarra, a shadow dragon, is a master spy, often infiltrating other dragon territories to learn their secrets. |
| 14 | Rimefrost | Rimefrost, a white dragon, is known to be a solitary creature, living in icy isolation and shrouded in a cloud of cold mystery. |
| 15 | Stormbellow | Stormbellow, a storm dragon, possesses the ability to summon thunderstorms and uses this power to awe and intimidate. |
| 16 | Thunderfury | Thunderfury, an electric dragon, is larger than life, exuding confidence and power. |
| 17 | Ulthion | This mist dragon, Ulthion, is a renowned sage who spends most of his time amidst the clouds, contemplating cosmic truths. |
| 18 | Volcanix | Volcanix, a robust magma dragon, commands the respect of others through his near unparalleled physical strength. |
| 19 | Wyrmshadow | Known for his stealth and cunning, Wyrmshadow, a void dragon, is considered a dangerous adversary. |
| 20 | Xarion | Xarion, a celestial dragon, is respected throughout the dragon world for his wisdom and nobility. |

## Dragonborn
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|------------|------|-------------|
| 1 | Thava Brightscale | A stern cleric of Bahamut, Thava is knowledgeable in matters of the divine. Her scales are a lustrous gold. |
| 2 | Rynthar Frostclaw | Rynthar is a reserved dragonborn warrior. His white scales resemble freshly fallen snow, matching his cold demeanor. |
| 3 | Torinn Ironshell | A blacksmith by trade, Torinn's scales mirror the charred metal he works with. He has a no-nonsense approach to life. |
| 4 | Arjhan Embermantle | A fiery red-scaled sorcerer with an equally fiery temper, Arjhan can be quick to anger but is fiercely loyal. |
| 5 | Ghesh Goldheart | A reclusive scholar, Ghesh's green scales are always hidden behind heavy robes. His pursuit of knowledge is relentless. |
| 6 | Sora Sunbrand | An ambassador blessed with radiant orange scales, Sora has an imposing presence in any diplomatic negotiation. |
| 7 | Zephon Darkwind | A stealthy rogue with sable scales, Zephon never stays in one place for long and is known for his silent moves. |
| 8 | Inthar Bluemoon | A ranger whose scales resemble the color of the high seas, Inthar is a skilled hunter and a stoic companion. |
| 9 | Vorjhan Shadowflame | A deceptive bard who uses his charming words to mesmerize his audience, Vorjhan's scales shimmer with purple haze. |
| 10 |  Azha Silvertongue | Azha is a silver-scaled dragonborn with a natural gift for languages and a diplomatic tact. |
| 11 | Qalthus Magmafist | A ferocious fighter whose scales glow like living ember, Qalthus is feared in battle for his vicious blows. |
| 12 | Kreel Dustwalker | Kreel is a stoic and solitary wanderer. His pale, almost grey scales tell stories of his travels through harsh lands. |
| 13 | Irthos Icefang | A stoic and diligent guard, Irthos's icy blue scales blend with the winter landscape of his homeland. |
| 14 | Nerix Steamwing | Steadfast and rigorous, Nerix is a seasoned warrior. Despite being wingless, his scales carry the shimmering hue of steam's mystique. |
| 15 | Tyaprin Quickwater | An agile and water-loving dragonborn. His bright blue scales reflect the freshwater streams he loves to inhabit. |
| 16 | Faelar Windvein | A silver dragonborn scholar specializing in history. Stoic and strictly disciplined, he values knowledge above all. |
| 17 | Rixwar Earthhorn | A stone-like, solid dragonborn who is seasoned in land-based combat maneuver. His scales match the rocky terrains he thrives in. |
| 18 | Korth Tempestwake | An azure scaled dragonborn and skillful sailor, Korth's life has forged him into a serious and unyieldingly resilient character. |
| 19 | Ysarix Stormheart | A broker with a noble aura. Ysarix's platinum scales mirror his wealthy, yet severe disposition. |
| 20 | Heraxus Skyshroud | An elusive rogue with mysterious charm. Characters find his dark scales intimidating and his gaze piercing. |

## Drow
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|------------|------|-------------|
| 1 | Izziryn Xiltyn | This tall, quiet drow is the matron's advisor and known for his ruthless tactics. |
| 2 | Neerza Zauviir | A drow priestess, well-known for her skill in manipulating shadows to her advantage. |
| 3 | Saphyl Baenre | A cunning rogue, always found lurking in the shadows and eavesdropping on others. |
| 4 | Pelaubryt Mizzrym | An esteemed drow warrior loyal to his house, bearing numerous battle scars. |
| 5 | G'eldreth T'sarran | An unsociable drow scholar. He spends most of his time studying ancient drow lore. |
| 6 | Filraen Melarn | A feared drow assassin who always has a sinister smile on his lips. |
| 7 | Sabal Xorlarrin | A charismatic drow merchant, shrouded in luxurious silks, always striking a hard bargain. |
| 8 | Liazmyne Do'Urden | A muscular drow warrior maiden, silent and reserved, revered for her deadly combat skills. |
| 9 | Xhalth Barrae | This suspicious drow mage sequesters himself studying dark magical arts. |
| 10 | Rizzen Duskryn | A tall, imposing drow, he’s a renowned swordmaster who never wastes his words. |
| 11 | Khalazza Dalael | A soft-spoken drow healer known for her gentle demeanour and warm smile. |
| 12 | Kendrak Kizzt | A world-weary drow ranger, his stern gaze carries an untold tale of sorrow. |
| 13 | Nym Maelra | A dusky-skinned drow enchantress, feared and respected for her ability to manipulate minds. |
| 14 | Jezdyn Ched'Nasad | A jaded drow diplomat, known for his shrewd negotiations and silver tongue. |
| 15 | Tazmyra Rilyntl | A graceful drow dancer, her performances are as mesmerising as they are rare. |
| 16 | Bael'Veiz Kluthrael | A stoic drow blacksmith, he is known for crafting the finest weapons in the underdark. |
| 17 | Vie'yara Sargtlin | The young drow is an apprentice alchemist, constantly curious and ever experimenting. |
| 18 | Zilvrae Zolond | A stalwart drow guard, she watches her post with an unwavering eye and a steady hand. |
| 19 | Faeryl Noquar | An elderly drow lore master, her wisdom and knowledge is sought by many. |
| 20 | Phaeqlyja Ousstyl | A drow sorceress, silent and ominous, her magic is as dangerous as it is unpredictable. |

## Duergar
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|---|---|---|
| 1 | Kildrak Frostbeard | A battle-hardened warrior with ice-blue eyes and a frost-covered beard. His grim demeanor matches his grim past. |
| 2 | Garunna Deepsorrow | An aged cleric, her eyes full of sorrow, burdened with the pain and loss she has seen in her long life. |
| 3 | Durnir Boulderbreaker | A burly smith, revered for his weapon craftsmanship. Despite his gruff exterior, he possesses a keen intelligence. |
| 4 | Thordal Shieldbiter | A reckless berserker, always eagerly rushing into the midst of battle with no thought for his own safety. Known for biting his shield in fury. |
| 5 | Eldeth Bronzehammer | A stonemason with a heart as sturdy as the statues she crafts. As silent and steadfast as the rocks she hews. |
| 6 | Dared Ironclaw | A venerable duergar leader known for his shrewd mind and iron resolve. His guidance sees his people through the harshest of times. |
